newsitem.title: POLAND: FORECAST - Polish 52-wk T-bill yield seen down.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Polish 52-wk T-bill yield seen down.

text.p: Banks expect the average yield on Poland's benchmark 52-week T-bill to fall to 17.53 percent at the end of 1997 against 19.84 percent at the last primary sale, a Reuters poll of the country's 25 largest banks showed.
Last month, banks saw the benchmark yield falling to 17.29 percent by year-end. The end-1997 forecasts ranged from 16.00 to 19.80 percent.
Banks expected the 52-week average yield would ease to 17.36 percent in January 1998 with a range of forecasts of 15.3 to 19.7 percent. @
They expected the yield to rise to 20.11 percent on avarage at the end of the month with a forecast range from 19.9 to 20.7 percent.
The average yield on the 13-week T-bill was also seen falling to 17.10 percent by year-end from 18.99 percent at the last primary auction, the poll showed.
The 13-week T-bill yield forecast is a mean average of banks' predictions ranging from 15.25 percent to 19.60 percent. @
The yield was seen falling to 16.83 percent with a forecast range between 14.5 and 19.5 percent and rising to 19.45 percent this month with a range from 19 to 20 percent.
